channel.title: Hi, I'm Osarenren Isorae on I.O
channel.description: Recent content in Hi, I'm Osarenren Isorae on I.O

item.title: Project II: Filerskeepers API(confidential)
item.description: Python Data Scientist filerskeepers 路 Full-time Oct 2020 - Jul 2022 路 1 yr 10 months Amsterdam, North Holland, Netherlands\ My first data job, I was the only data Engineer in the team. I brainstormed with the CEO, and took note of two things; our available data and how we acquire them. v.1 of projectX had the following tools: Web extracting tool, collecting over ten thousand links per day. Web availability tool, running daily checks on the statuses of our live urls.

item.title: Project I: Fmoh ISS
item.description: Python Web Developer ehealth4everyone 路 Internship July 2019 - Dec 2020 路 6 months FCT Abuja, Nigeria Three months before my internship, I took a course on Udemy: Django Dev to Deployment. We explored a real estate web application,github This training gave me the knowledge of building a Real Estate listing application, including an admin dashboard. The first few weeks was spent onboarding and introduction to our code base. We then installed the development version to our individual systems.

item.title: Project III: Generating Keywords for Google Ads
item.description: Data Science Project Nov 2022 Lagos Nigeria Imagine working for a digital marketing agency, and the agency is approached by a massive online retailer of furniture. They want to test our skills at creating large campaigns for all of their website. We are tasked with creating a prototype set of keywords for search campaigns for their sofas section. The client says that they want us to generate keywords for the following products:sofas, convertible_sofas, love_seats, recliners, sofa_beds.

item.title: About
item.description: I studied mechanical engineering at the University of Nigeria, Nsukka for over 4 years, then I dropped out during my 6 months internship as I got retained by ehealth4everyone as a Python Django Developer. I worked closely with data as I helped build a data collection application, with numerous API endpoints and functionalities. I got into the mentoring part of the software as I led a weekly study program for aspiring python developers until covid.
